level.text: Tickets printed for raffles shall include the following:
Name of the licensed organization listed on the license;
Date, time, place, and exact address of the drawing;
Prizes to be awarded;
Aggregate value of the prizes;
Cost of the raffle ticket;
Purpose for which net proceeds will be used;
Statement that the winner need not be present at the drawing to win;
Appropriate odds of winning, assuming all raffle tickets printed are sold; and
The phrase “Licensed by the D.C. Lottery and Charitable Games Control Board.”

Tickets shall have pre-printed consecutive numbers and a stub held by the licensed organization listing the name, address, and phone number of the person purchasing each ticket. This stub shall be used in the raffle draw.
The price to the public of all tickets for any one raffle draw shall be in one fixed amount.
Only United States currency or coin shall be accepted by a licensed organization as payment for any raffle ticket.
Prior to the license being issued, but subsequent to Board approval of the application, the applicant shall provide a statement from the printer on a form provided by the Board stating the following:
The total number of tickets to be printed;
The first numbered ticket to be printed;
The last numbered ticket to be printed; and
That the tickets were numbered consecutively and that there were no duplications.
Prior to the license being issued, but subsequent to Board approval of the application, the applicant shall provide to the Board the printer’s proof of the tickets.

level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 35 DCR 3788, 3811 (May 20, 1988).
